params.data: The ABI encoded pick indices for all Draws. Expected to be winning picks. Pick indices must be less than the totalUserPicks.
params.drawIds: drawId array for which to calculate prize amounts for.
params.user: User for which to calculate prize amount.

returns._0: List of awardable prize amounts ordered by drawId.

claimOwnership().details: This function is only callable by the `_pendingOwner`.

params._drawBuffer: The address of the draw buffer to push draws to

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

Deployed(address,address,address).notice: Emitted when the contract is initialized

PrizeDistributorSet(address).notice: Emitted when the prizeDistributor is set/updated

calculate(address,uint32[],bytes).notice: Calculates the prize amount for a user for Multiple Draws. Typically called by a PrizeDistributor.

claimOwnership().notice: Allows the `_pendingOwner` address to finalize the transfer.

getNormalizedBalancesForDrawIds(address,.notice: Returns a users balances expressed as a fraction of the total supply over time.

owner().notice: Returns the address of the current owner.

prizeDistributionBuffer().notice: The stored history of draw settings.  Stored as ring buffer.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows current owner to set the `_pendingOwner` address.

userdoc.notice: The DrawCalculator calculates a user's prize by matching a winning random number against their picks. A users picks are generated deterministically based on their address and balance of tickets held. Prize payouts are divided into multiple tiers: grand prize, second place, etc... A user with a higher average weighted balance (during each draw period) will be given a large number of picks to choose from, and thus a higher chance to match the winning numbers.
